result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Bradley E. Wartzok was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: With huber privileges.  Jail to commence on or before Nov. 14, 2014.  No good time.

Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both
Defendant may apply for expungment if law abiding & fine paid in full within 12 mos.. Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NCP entered, advised of const. rights, plea accepted by Ct.  Ct. withholds adj. of guilt. Deferred Prosecution Ordered 12 mo. on Ct. 1; Filed agreement.

Defendant Bradley E. Wartzok in court with attorney Mark Phillip Maciolek.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 2:
12 months Probation
5 days SCJ, w/work release.  Commence on or before Nov. 14, 2014 @ 7:30 pm
No good time.
Undergo any counseling per agent
Absolute Sobriety of alcohol & controlled substances 
No entry taverns or liquor stores or other establishments that main purpose is the sale of alcohol
Maintain full time employment/school or combination of both
$563.25  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Defendant may apply for expungment if law abiding & fine paid in full within 12 mos.. Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Bradley E. Wartzok in court with attorney Mark Phillip Maciolek.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant now 1:29.   Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.

Defendant Bradley E. Wartzok not in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant stay one week.  Return date scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Cover Letter from Attorney Maciolek to Br. 3
No possession of any controlled substances w/o a valid Rx

ADDRESS INFO for Bradley E. Wartzok
Current: 8855 Von Wald Road, Prairie du Sac, WI 53578 United States  (Effective: 09-05-2014)
Prior: S9020 Von Wald Rd, Prairie Du Sac, WI 53578

Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Return date on October 10, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Bradley E. Wartzok appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  No criminal history.  Request $150.00 cash bond w/ conditions.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  Ties to the community and also no criminal history.   Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived. $2000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No possession of any controlled substances w/out a valid Rx.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 11:30 am.  Return date scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
